alert.note: Alert for Central Chippewa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: Briefly heavy lake effect snow showers will continue in eastern upper Michigan late this afternoon. When combined with northwest winds gusting to 40 mph, falling and blowing snow will result in periodic very low visibility. In open areas in central Chippewa County, brief whiteout conditions can be expected with near zero visibility. Gradual improvement is expected this evening, as lake effect snow showers weaken, and winds start to diminish. If you are traveling in central Chippewa County this afternoon, be alert to rapidly changing visibilities. Brief whiteout conditions will remain possible in open areas. This includes part of the M-28 and I-75 corridors. Slow down, and allow plenty of extra time to reach your destination.
